meanings.def: of or belonging to the person or people being spoken or written to
examples: Excuse me, is this your seat?
The bank is on your right.

meanings.def: of or belonging to people in general
examples: Dentists advise you to have your teeth checked every six months.
In Japan you are taught great respect for your elders.

meanings.def: used to show that somebody/something is well known or often talked about
examples: This is your typical English pub.
(ironic, disapproving) You and your bright ideas!

meanings.def: used in some titles, especially those of royal people
